intro: Triraphis glomerata, commonly known as the clustered triraphis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high temperatures. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Triraphis glomerata is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
